channel.title: Let's Talk About Television
channel.description:
Anybody here still watch a bit of TV every now and again? After the internet started getting mainstream it seems none of my friends watch TV anymore, not even for entertainment.
So let's talk about it.
I freaking love It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia. There, now it's your turn.

item.description:

item.description:
Yeah, lens flares typically signify when shit’s about to go down

Also, watching Sym-bionic titan. Way better than people let on. Genndy Tartakovsky = good. end of.

item.title: Let's Talk About Television
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
I recall the lense flare being used to great effect in the portals between alternate universes and such; it seems to only be prominent when there’s mad science going on.

item.description:
It seems like, from this video, that Fringe did away with the lens flares. I haven’t really watched too much of the show; when did they do away with the lens flares? Or is this just one of those odd scenes without them?

item.title: Let's Talk About Television
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
This is its last season anyway, and it’s only 13 episodes. But I wonder how much that had to do with Fox putting it on hiatus every other week.

Edit: Here’s the link

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Fringe_episodes

Go and look at how many stretches of more than 7 days there are between episodes. I count 4 in the first season alone.

Read full topic

item.title: Let's Talk About Television
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Kairouseki:

Fucking Fox put Fringe on hiatus for three weeks. They keep doing that, as well as putting it in the death slot, and wonder why it gets bad ratings.

Damnit Fox, this is how you kill TV shows.

Read full topic

item.title: Let's Talk About Television
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Pyro:

“Things online” actually includes a lot of TV shows.

Yes, but the only time I actually watch a television show on an actual television is when I watch walking dead every Sunday.

Read full topic

item.title: Let's Talk About Television
item.dc:creator: Jethrosoup
item.description:
Winged One:

Food Network

Good Eats, man. Alton Brown is the kind of person who can talk about absolutely anything and be absolutely correct, always.

Read full topic

item.title: Let's Talk About Television
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
xalener:

As for other shows, basically the cartoon network suite. Adventure Time, Regular Show, Gumball occasionally (the show just looks beautiful, regardless of entertainment value; I watch it just to gawk sometimes) most Adult Swim stuff. I’m good with it.
Other than that, If I’m ever watching TV I just leave it on the science channel. Whatever’s on, it’s usually engaging.

Glad I’m not the only one that enjoys Gumball or Regular Show.

When I just want to put something on, I usually look to the Travel Channel or the Food Network.

Read full topic

item.title: Let's Talk About Television
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
xalener:

Other than that, If I’m ever watching TV I just leave it on the science channel. Whatever’s on, it’s usually engaging.

If I ever want something to just play in the background while I’m working, I’ll play Modern Marvels or How It’s Made on Netflix.

Read full topic

item.title: Let's Talk About Television
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

Top Gear (UK, love the hosts, haven’t tried US even though I live in the US…)

Avoid the US version at all fucking costs. It’s a god damn travesty.

Imagine if TLC’s Gib arm- fake scripted camaraderie-close up of every fucking audience member as they laugh at the fake horrible jokes bullshit got into Top Gear.

Think Tim & Eric’s Crimbus special. That whole special was a parody of these exact production tropes. US Top Gear is that bad.

The only serial I watch atm is Fringe, and I’m still spotty with it. Love it tho.

As for other shows, basically the cartoon network suite. Adventure Time, Regular Show, Gumball occasionally (the show just looks beautiful, regardless of entertainment value; I watch it just to gawk sometimes) most Adult Swim stuff. I’m good with it.
Other than that, If I’m ever watching TV I just leave it on the science channel. Whatever’s on, it’s usually engaging.

Read full topic

item.title: Let's Talk About Television
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
0_22one:

I generally only watch things online, but I do like walking dead.

“Things online” actually includes a lot of TV shows.

Edit: also I’m rewatching the last episode of Legend of Korra right now. I haven’t actually seen the whole thing without it being corrupted.

Read full topic
